name: Mexican Greek Stuffed Green Peppers
ingredientLines: 3 green bell peppers, tops and seeds removed
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Cook the rice in a pot of water according to the instructions on the packaging.
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir beef in the hot skillet until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes, drain and discard grease.
Add water and taco seasoning to ground beef, cook and stir until until water evaporates, about 5 minutes.
Mix ground beef mixture, rice, tomato soup, tomato, mushrooms, red onion, feta cheese, and green onions together in a bowl, spoon into green bell peppers.
Arrange stuffed peppers in a baking dish.
Bake in the preheated oven until peppers are softened and filling is cooked through, about 1 hour. Serve with kalamata olives on the side.

name: Meatballs With Peas And Cuttlefish
instructions: Cut the legs of the cuttlefish in small pieces. Chop 2 cloves of garlic and 3 stems of parsley.
Mix the ground pork, egg, salt black pepper, legs of the cuttlefish, soaked bread, garlic and parsley, and make small round balls.
Dust with flour, fry the meatballs in a pan with a bit of olive oil and reserve.
Dice the cuttlefish in cubes and cook it in a covered pan with some olive oil.
Chop the onion and cook it at low-medium heat until it turns dark brown. Then add the tomato sauce and let cook for 10 minutes. Add wine and reduce.
Add the cooked cuttlefish and meatballs to the big pan. Cover with water. Cook for 15 minutes, add peas and serve.

name: Mexican Black Beans And Rice
instructions: Cook the rice in a pot of water according to the instructions on the packaging.
Heat coconut oil in a large skillet over medium-low heat.
Add chili powder, garlic powder, cumin, and coriander, fry until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
Add celery, cook and stir until softened, 3 to 5 minutes.
Add tomato, frozen corn, oregano, and cilantro, stir to coat. Stir in black beans and salsa.
Bring to a simmer and cook for 10 to 15 minutes, adding water as needed to keep the mixture saucy.
Remove from the heat and stir in cooked rice until coated. Season with salt.

name: Mexican Frittata
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350°F. Oil a small casserole dish with olive oil.
Heat oil in a 12-inch nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add onion and cook until tender, about 5 minutes.
While onion is cooking, combine milk, egg whites, whole eggs, salt, pepper, cilantro, cheese and cumin into a medium bowl using a whisk.
Transfer onion to the prepared casserole dish. Pour egg mixture over the top.
Bake in the preheated oven until eggs are set, about 30 minutes.
Remove frittata from the oven and cut into wedges or squares.

name: Mexican Huevos Rancheros
instructions: Bring a large pot of water to boil. Cook tomato, serrano chile, and garlic for 5 minutes. Drain and let cool slightly. Peel tomato.
Combine tomato, serrano chile, garlic, salt, and pepper in a blender; blend until smooth.
Heat oil in a small skillet over high heat. Fry tortillas individually until soft but not crispy, about 10 seconds.
Heat oil in a small skillet over high heat. Fry tortillas individually until soft but not crispy, about 10 seconds.
Spread 2 tablespoons refried beans on each tortilla. Add an egg and top with tomato sauce. Serve immediately.

name: Mexican Baked Fish
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F. Lightly grease one 8x12 inch baking dish.
Rinse fish fillets under cold water, and pat dry with paper towels. Lay fillets side by side in the prepared baking dish.
Pour the salsa over the top, and sprinkle evenly with the shredded cheese. Top with the crushed corn chips. Bake for 15 minutes. Serve immediately.

name: Mexican Drunken Beans
instructions: Put mayocoba beans into a large container with enough cool water to cover by several inches. Let beans soak 8 hours to overnight.
Drain mayocoba beans and rinse thoroughly, put into a large stockpot.
Pour enough water into the pot to cover beans by a few inches, bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to medium-low and place a cover on the pot, and cook at a simmer until beans are soft in the center, about 90 minutes.
While the beans simmer, heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook and stir onion in hot oil until tender, about 5 minutes.
Add tomatoes and serrano pepper and simmer until the tomatoes have softened slightly, about 5 minutes.
Reduce heat to medium-low and continue cooking until the liquid begins to thicken, about 10 minutes more. Remove from heat.
Cook and stir bacon in a large, deep skillet over medium-high heat until very crispy, about 10 minutes.
Remove bacon from skillet with a slotted spoon and drain on a plate lined with paper towel.
Cook ham cubes in the bacon fat in the skillet until browned, about 5 minutes, remove with slotted spoon to the plate with the bacon to drain.
Once the beans have cooked, stir the tomato mixture, bacon, ham, beer, jalapeno peppers, cilantro, and bouillon granules into the beans, season with sea salt.
Bring the mixture to a simmer and cook until the beans are completely softened, about 30 minutes.

name: Mexican Egg Muffins
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
In a pan heat 1 tbsp oil. Add chopped Garlic. Followed by chopped onion. Fry till the onion looks soft and cooked.
Add Chopped tomatoes. Cook the tomatoes are cooked for about 2 minutes.
Add chopped red bell pepper. Slightly crush the bean and corn using a potato masher. Add to the pan and mix. Add salt, pepper, and chili powder.
Meanwhile, crack the egg in a mixing bowl. Add milk. Season with salt and pepper.
Divide the egg mixture equally among 6 muffin cups. Spoon the above-cooked mixture equally into the cups. Sprinkle shredded cheese on top.
Bake for 10 minutes and serve warm.

name: Mexican Style Shredded Pork
instructions: Place the roast in a slow cooker, and season with salt. Place chile peppers and garlic on top of roast. Pour in the chipotle sauce and 1/2 cup water.
Cover, and cook 7 hours on Low.
In a pot, bring remaining 2 3/4 cups water and rice to a boil. Mix in the lime juice and cilantro. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer 20 minutes.
Remove roast from the slow cooker, and use two forks to shred.
Return pork to the slow cooker, and allow to sit 15 minutes to absorb some of the liquid. Serve over the cooked rice.

name: Mexican Cream Cheese Dip
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350°F.
Combine salsa, spinach, cream cheese, 1 cup Cheddar cheese, and Mexican seasoning in a large bowl.
Spread into an oven-safe dish. Sprinkle with remaining Cheddar cheese.
Bake, uncovered, in the preheated oven until heated through and cheese is melted, 20 to 25 minutes.

name: Mexican Couscous Salad
ingredientLines: 4 oz canned black beans, rinsed and drained
4 oz canned corn, rinsed and drained
instructions: Place salt and onion powder and couscous in a bowl, quickly toss to combine. Add boiling water, cover and set aside for 5 minutes.
Add remaining ingredients. Season with lemon juice, salt and olive oil. Mix all together and serve.

name: Mexican Ceviche
ingredientLines: 1/2 lb jumbo shrimp, peeled and deveined
instructions: Place shrimp in a bowl (You may either coarsely chop the shrimp, or leave them whole, depending on your preference.)
Add lemon, covering shrimp completely. Cover, and refrigerate for 30 minutes, or until opaque and slightly firm.
Add tomatoes, onions, cucumber, radishes, and garlic; toss to combine. Gradually add cilantro and jalapenos to desired taste.
Cover, and refrigerate for 1 hour. Serve chilled.

name: Muffins With Ham And Cheese
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
In a medium size mixing bowl combine the eggs, cream, baking powder, salt and pepper.
Beat the mixture until completely combined. Stir in the chopped ham and shredded cheese until evenly distributed.
Spoon the mixture using a 1/4 cup measuring cup into a  muffin tin with parchment paper.
Bake 20 minutes until the muffins have set and a toothpick comes out cleanly.

name: Mexican Meatless Lasagna
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F. Oil a square baking dish.
Spray a skillet with cooking spray. Add squash and onion and cook over medium heat until softened, 3 to 5 minutes.
Add refried beans and cook until heated through, about 3 minutes. Remove from the heat.
Using 1/4 of the ingredients at a time, make 4 layers in the prepared baking dish as follows.
Tortilla, refried bean mixture, black beans, cottage cheese, mozzarella cheese, Cheddar cheese, and salsa. Repeat layers 3 more times.
Bake in the preheated oven until bubbly and heated through, 20 to 25 minutes.

name: Meixcan Turkey Casserole
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350°F.
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil, cook the rotini at a boil until tender yet firm to the bite, about 10 minutes, drain.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add ground turkey and break it up with a wooden spoon.
Add chili powder, garlic, cumin, cayenne pepper, oregano, and black pepper, mix thoroughly.
Cook and stir until turkey is browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes.
Add corn, diced tomatoes and chiles, green bell pepper, onion, celery, and carrot; mix thoroughly.
Place lid on skillet. Cook until vegetables are tender, stirring occasionally, about 8 minutes.
Add tomato sauce, let simmer until thickened, about 5 minutes. Transfer turkey mixture to a casserole dish and add the cooked pasta.
Mix everything together. Top with cheese. Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is melted, about 10 minutes.

name: Mediterranean Cauliflower Rice
instructions: Place the cauliflower florets in a bowl of a food processor. Pulse until the cauliflower is grated.
Place a pan large enough to hold the cauliflower on the stove on medium-high heat.
Add olive oil, and once you see the oil shimmer, add the garlic and cook until fragrant, about one minute. Add the grated cauliflower and saute for 1 minute.
Reduce heat to low and continue cooking, stirring frequently for 5 more minutes.
Remove from heat. Season with salt and cumin, add lemon juice, parsley and toasted walnuts. Serve warm.

name: Meatball Zucchini Soup
instructions: In a large bowl, combine ground beef, eggs, cauliflower, salt, pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, and oregano.
Scoop a heaping tablespoon of the mixture into your palms, and roll into 1-2 inch meatballs.
Heat olive oil in a large Dutch oven, add in onion with a pinch of salt, and cook for 5 minutes or until softened and translucent.
Add in garlic, oregano, and another pinch of salt and pepper and cook for another 5 minutes.
Add in broth, bring to a boil and reduce back down to a simmer.  Carefully adding meatballs and simmer for 15 minutes.
Add in carrots and zucchini and simmer for 30 minutes or until all the veggies are tender.

name: Mexican Pork Chops
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Oil a baking dish.
Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Sprinkle pork chops with salt and black pepper, and brown them on both sides, about 5 minutes per side. Set chops aside.
Mix the water, rice, tomato sauce, picante sauce, and taco seasoning in the prepared baking dish.
Lay the chops into the rice mixture. Cover the dish.
Bake in the preheated oven until the chops are no longer pink inside and the rice is tender, about 1 hour.

name: Mexican Shepherds Pie
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F.  Oil a baking dish.
Place the beef and onion in a skillet over medium heat. Cook until beef is evenly brown and onion is tender. Drain grease.
Season with garlic powder, salt, and pepper. Mix in the tomatoes, and cook 5 minutes. Stir in the taco seasoning and water.
Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, and continue cooking 5 minutes, until thickened. Transfer to the prepared baking dish, and top evenly with corn.
Prepare the corn muffin mix according to package directions. Spread evenly over the corn layer in the baking dish.
Bake 20 minutes in the preheated oven, or until puffed and golden. Garnish with olives and cheese.

name: Mexican Orzo Salad
instructions: Fill a large pot with lightly salted water and bring to a boil over high heat.
Stir in the orzo, and return to a boil. Cook the pasta uncovered, stirring occasionally, about 10 minutes. Drain.
Place the drained orzo in a large salad bowl, and fold in the red pepper, yellow pepper, green onions, red onion.
Chickpeas, kidney beans, black beans, corn, cilantro, and salt and pepper to taste.
Pour the lime juice and oil over the salad, toss to coat, and refrigerate at least 2 hours to chill before serving.

name: Mexican Chicken Soup
instructions: Combine water, broth, chicken, 1/2 of the cauliflower, 1/2 of the celery, onion, garlic, cayenne, garlic powder, seasoned salt, cumin, black pepper, and bay leaves in a large stockpot.
Bring to a boil, reduce heat and let simmer until chicken is cooked through, about 20 minutes.
Remove chicken and shred with 2 forks. Remove stock from heat and puree with an immersion blender.
dd shredded chicken, soybeans, mushrooms, baby corn, red peppers, and lime juice to the pot and stir to combine.
Return to a boil, reduce heat and let simmer for 1 hour. Serve.

name: Mexican Shashuka
ingredientLines: 4 oz roasted red bell peppers, chopped
instructions: Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Saute onions until translucent and tender, about 5 minutes.
Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Saute onions until translucent and tender, about 5 minutes.
Stir in tomato paste, chili powder and ancho chili powder, cumin, and paprika. Saute for another minute or so until well combined.
Stir in diced tomatoes and water. Season with salt and pepper.
Raise heat to medium-high and bring mixture to a boil. Immediately reduce heat to medium and cook about 5 minutes.
Reduce heat to medium-low. Make a well for each egg and pour 1 egg into each well.
Cover;,poach until whites are firm and yolks have thickened but are not hard, 2 1/2 to 5 minutes.

name: Nuggets
ingredientLines: 3/4 lb chicken tenders, cut into bite sized pieces
instructions: Place chicken in a bowl, sprinkle with ranch seasoning, and toss to combine. Let sit for 5-10 minutes.
Place flour in a resealable bag. Place egg in a small bowl and panko bread crumbs on a plate.
Preheat air fryer to 390°F.
Place chicken into the bag and toss to coat.
Lightly dip chicken into egg mixture, letting excess drip off. Roll chicken pieces in panko, pressing crumbs into the chicken.
Oil basket of the air fryer with oil and place chicken pieces inside, making sure not to overlap.
You may have to do two batches, depending on the size of your air fryer. Lightly mist chicken with cooking spray.
Cook for 4 minutes. Turn chicken pieces and cook until chicken is no longer pink on the inside, about 4 more minutes. Serve immediately.

name: Mutton Bhuna
instructions: Cook the rice in a pot of water according to the instructions on the packaging.
Heat oil in a pressure cooker.
When it is hot, add crushed cloves, black peppercorns, black cardamom, green cardamom, bay leaf and cinnamon and fry for a few seconds.
Add onions and green chillies and fry until they turn slightly brown.
Add ginger and garlic and fry till onions turn golden brown.
Now add mutton and cook on high heat for 3-4 minutes. Add ½ cup water and salt to taste to the cooker.
Put on the lid of the pressure cooker and cook till mutton is almost done. Remove the cooker from heat and let it cool.
Remove the lid of the pressure cooker. Add curd, red chilli powder, turmeric powder, coriander powder and in the mutton.
Cover with a regular lid and cook on low flame till oil separates and masala is nicely browned.
Add garam masala powder and fresh coriander and mix well. Serve hot with basmati rice.

name: Minestrone Soup
ingredientLines: 2 oz canned corn, rinsed and drained
instructions: Heat the oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the onion, potato, carrot, salt, and black pepper, and cook, stirring occasionally, for 8 minutes, until the vegetables begin to soften.
Add the garlic, corn, tomatoes, green beans, white beans, peas, broth, and paprika. Cover and simmer for 20 minutes.
Stir in the pasta and cook, uncovered, for 10 more minutes, until the pasta is cooked through.
Season to taste and serve.

name: Meixcan Gazpacho
instructions: Rub the poblano pepper with olive oil. Roast over the gas flame of your stove, turning often, until the skin is black, 7 to 10 minutes.
Place pepper into a paper bag and seal; set aside to cool, about 10 minutes.
Combine cucumber and onion in a bowl. Set aside.
Take cooled poblano from the bag and scrape off the burned skin. Remove stem and seeds, roughly chop the pepper.
Place tomatoes, poblano, jalapeno, garlic, lime juice, sugar, salt, pepper, and cumin into the bowl of a food processor and pulse until thick and not runny.
Add cucumber and onion, pulse 3 to 4 times to incorporate. Refrigerate until chilled, about 30 minutes. Serve.

name: Mexican Street Corn Salad
instructions: Separate the egg yolks (you won’t need the egg whites), and add them to a food processor or blender.
Next, add vinegar, lime juice, salt, and mustard, and mix briefly until combined.
Add oil in a slow steady stream and mix until it emulsifies and is the consistency of mayonnaise. Set aside your mayonnaise.
Add mayo and all other ingredients except for corn into a blender and blend until smooth.
Pour this sauce mixture over the cooled corn and mix gently to coat the corn. Serve immediately.

name: Mexican Tomato Rice And Beans
ingredientLines: 6 oz canned black beans, rinsed and drained
instructions: Bring the water to boil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat, add the rice, cover with a lid and simmer on low for 15 minutes.
Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic to the skillet and saute for 1 minute, stirring constantly.
Add the black beans, cumin, chili powder, oregano, sea salt, and freshly cracked pepper, to taste.
Stir in tomatoes. Adjust the heat to maintain a gentle boil and cook, stirring occasionally, until the beans absorb much of the liquid, 5 minutes
Add cilantro and cooked rice then cook, stirring occasionally, until the rice is warm, 2 minutes. Serve immediately.

name: Mushroom Couscous
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: In a large skillet, cook the onion and mushrooms in oil, over medium heat, until all of the liquid has evaporated.
Remove half of the mushrooms from the skillet and reserve for later.
Add the garlic to the skillet and cook for 1 minute. Then add the couscous, salt, pepper, and veggie broth.
Bring the broth to a boil, cover it with a lid, and then turn off the heat. Let it rest for 5 minutes. Open the lid and add the mushrooms back in. Stir and serve immediately.

name: Mexican Stuffed Peppers
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Cook the rice in a pot of water according to the instructions on the packaging.
Bring a large pot of water and 1 tablespoon salt to a boil, cook green bell peppers in the boiling water until slightly softened, 3 to 4 minutes. Drain.
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat, cook and stir onion in the hot oil until softened and transparent, 5 to 10 minutes.
Mix rice, black beans, tomatoes, and cooked onion in a large bowl.
Add chili powder, garlic salt, cumin, salt, stir until evenly mixed. Fold 1/2 cheese blend into rice mixture.
Spoon rice mixture into each bell pepper, arrange peppers in 9x9-inch baking dish. Sprinkle peppers with remaining cheese.
Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is melted and bubbling, about 30 minutes.

name: Mexican Stuffed Chicken
instructions: Place toothpicks in a small bowl and cover with water, let them soak to keep them from burning while cooking.
Mix 2 teaspoons chili powder and 2 teaspoons cumin in a shallow dish.
Preheat an air fryer to 400°F.
Place chicken breast on a flat work surface. Slice horizontally through the middle.
Pound each half using a kitchen mallet or rolling pin until about 1/4-inch thick.
Sprinkle each breast half equally with remaining chili powder, remaining cumin, chipotle flakes, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Place 1/2 the bell pepper, onion, and jalapeno in the center of 1 breast half. Roll the chicken from the tapered end upward and use 2 toothpicks to secure.
Repeat with other breast, spices, and vegetables and secure with remaining toothpicks.
Roll each roll-up in the chili-cumin mixture in the shallow dish while drizzling with olive oil until evenly covered.
Place roll-ups in the air-fryer basket with the toothpick side facing up. Set timer for 6 minutes.
Turn roll-ups over. Continue cooking in the air fryer until juices run clear. Drizzle lime juice evenly on roll-ups before serving.

name: Mushroom Stroganoff
instructions: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add egg noodles, and cook until al dente, about 7 minutes. Remove from heat, drain, and set aside.
At the same time, melt ghee in a large heavy skillet over medium heat. Add onion, and cook, stirring until softened.
Turn the heat up to medium-high, and add sliced mushrooms. Cook until the mushrooms are limp and browned. Remove to a bowl, and set aside.
In the same skillet, stir in vegetable broth. Bring to a boil, and cook until the mixture has reduced by 1/3. Reduce heat to low, and return the mushrooms and onion to the skillet.
Remove the pan from the heat, stir in the sour cream then blend into the mushrooms. Return the skillet to the burner, and continue cooking over low heat.
Stir in the parsley, and season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve over cooked egg noodles.

name: Mexican Shrimp Cocktail
instructions: Mix roma tomatoes, sweet onion, ketchup, tomato and clam juice cocktail, salsa in a glass salad bowl.
Add cilantro, salsa verde, lime juice, hot pepper sauce, and garlic, cover and refrigerate until cold, about 1 hour.
Cut tails from shrimp, if present, and gently fold into tomato mixture, stir avocado into shrimp cocktail.

name: Mexican Rice
instructions: Heat oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Cook and stir rice and onion in the hot oil until browned, about 5 minutes, season with salt, cumin, and pepper.
Pour water over the rice mixture. Stir tomato sauce and chicken bouillon into the water.
Increase heat to medium-high, place a cover on the saucepan, and bring to a boil.
Add serrano chile pepper and continue cooking at a boil for 10 minutes.
Reduce heat to medium-low until the rice is tender and the water is absorbed, 10 to 15 minutes more.

name: Mexican Shredded Chicken Soup
instructions: Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat; stir in onion and garlic.
Cook and stir until the onion has softened and turned translucent, about 5 minutes, add chicken and cook for 5 minutes more
Add tomatoes, chili powder, cumin, and oregano. Stir in chicken broth and water, bring to a boil.
Reduce to a simmer and cook for 5 to 10 minutes.
Add black beans, hominy, cilantro, and jalapeno pepper. Simmer until heated through, at least 10 minutes.

name: Mushrooms, Chickpea, Spinach Stir-Fry
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Saute onion and garlic in the oil until they start to become tender.
Add the mushrooms, and fry until they begin to shrink, about 3 minutes. Toss in the spinach and chickpeas, and fry, stirring constantly for a few minutes.
Add the vinegar, stirring constantly until absorbed, then stir in the white wine. Reduce heat, and simmer until the wine has almost completely absorbed.
Season with salt and pepper to taste, and sprinkle with fresh parsley. Serve hot.

name: Mexican Zucchini Boats
ingredientLines: 3 zucchini, halved and seeds scooped out
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F. Oil the bottom of a baking dish with olive oil.
Fill a large skillet with water and bring to a boil. Boil zucchini halves for 1 minute. Drain.
Heat the large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir ground beef and onion in the hot skillet until beef is browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes.
Add tomato sauce, corn, bell pepper, and taco seasoning, cook and stir until bubbly.
Place zucchini halves into the prepared baking dish, cut-sides up. Scoop meat mixture into the boats and sprinkle cheese on top.
Bake in the preheated oven until tender and cheese is melted, about 30 minutes. Garnish with scallions.

name: Mozzarella-Eggplant Parmesan
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F.
Trim the ends off the eggplant, slice into ½-inch rounds. Transfer the rounds to a baking sheet lined with paper towels and sprinkle with salt. Let sit for 10 minutes.
In a medium bowl, whisk together the almond meal, Italian seasoning, and a pinch of salt. Beat the eggs in another medium bowl with a splash of water.
Add the rice flour to another medium bowl. Coat the salted eggplant rounds in the rice flour, then in the egg, then in the seasoned almond meal.
Set the rounds on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Drizzle on both sides with olive oil.
Bake the eggplant, flipping halfway through for even browning, for 20 minutes.
Heat a drizzle of olive oil in a medium saucepan over medium-low heat. Add the garlic and red pepper flakes and cook for 3 minutes. Add basil and stir.
Add the crushed tomatoes and stir to combine. Cover and simmer for 15 minutes.
To assemble, spread a bit of sauce in the bottom of a 9x13-inch dish, then add a layer of eggplant.
Top with more sauce and sprinkle with the mozzarella and Parmesan cheese. Repeat with the remaining ingredients. Bake for 10 minutes, serve immediately.

name: Mushroom Gnocchi
instructions: Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add the gnocchi and cook for 2 minutes until the first few gnocchi begin to float to the surface.
In a large skillet, melt the butter on medium heat and add the mushrooms and garlic. Cook until mushrooms begin to soften and brown.
Add the cooked bacon, then add the cream cheese and stir until it's melted.
Add the milk, chives, salt and pepper to the skillet with the mushrooms and bacon and stir to combine all the ingredients.
Drain the gnocchi and add to the skillet. Stir to combine and add the Parmesan cheese.
Heat for about 2 minutes until the sauce begins to thicken and the cheese is melted. It will continue to thicken after being removed from the heat.

name: Noodle Pancit With Chicken
instructions: Place the rice noodles in a large bowl, and cover with warm water. When soft, drain, and set aside.
Heat oil in a wok or large skillet over medium heat. Saute onion and garlic until soft. Stir in chicken cabbage, carrots and soy sauce.
Cook until cabbage begins to soften. Toss in noodles, and cook until heated through, stirring constantly. Transfer pancit to a serving dish and serve immediately.

name: Mushroom Soup
instructions: In a large saucepan, heat butter and oil over medium-high heat. Saute mushrooms and onion until tender.
Mix flour, salt, pepper and broth until smooth; stir into mushroom mixture.
Bring to a boil. Cook and stir until thickened, about 2 minutes. Reduce heat; stir in cream. and carrot.
Simmer, uncovered, until flavors are blended, about 15 minutes, stirring occasionally.

name: Miso Grilled Salmon
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F.
Fill a large skillet with about 1 inch of water and bring to a boil. Poach fish just until cooked on the outside, about 2 minutes per side. Transfer fillets to a broiler pan.
In a small bowl, stir together the miso paste, sake, sesame seeds, sesame oil, water, soy sauce and rice vinegar. Spread this over the tops of the salmon fillets.
Bake for 15 minutes in the preheated oven, or until almost cooked through. Switch the oven to broil, and broil about 5 minutes. Cut fillets into portions to serve.

name: Mushrooms With Quail Eggs
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Clean mushrooms and remove the stalks. Break a quail egg in the mushroom.
Season with salt, pepper and bake for 15 minutes.

name: Meatballs With Zoodles
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F. Line a large sheet pan with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, add turkey, onion, egg, pepper, almond flour, garlic powder, and onion powder. Stir and mix until everything is evenly mixed.
Scoop 2 tbsp of meatball mixture. Gently roll into ball shape. Place onto baking sheet. Repeat with remaining meat.
Bake meatballs for about 20 minutes or until fully cooked.
In a large skillet, add olive oil and garlic. Bring to medium high heat.
Add in zucchini noodles. Cook until water releases from zucchini and zucchini noodles are just cooked.
Divide zucchini noodles into meal prep containers. Add meatballs, and serve.

name: No-Bake Energy Balls
instructions: Stir oats, chocolate chips, flax seed, peanut butter, honey, cranberries, and vanilla extract together in a bowl.
Roll dough into balls with your hands. Arrange balls on a baking sheet and freeze until set, about 1 hour.

name: Mustard Baked Chicken
instructions: Preheat oven to 375ºF.
Season chicken breasts generously with salt and pepper, and Italian seasoning, and place in a large baking dish with butter.
Top with mustard and cheese, and cover with aluminum foil.
Place in a oven and bake for 25 minutes.

name: Mini Bacon Cheese Balls
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Place the cream cheese, cheddar, Parmesan, garlic, kosher salt, black pepper, parsley, and cayenne pepper in your food processor. Process until well blended.
Using a rubber spatula, scrape the mixture into a shallow bowl, cover, and freeze for 5 minutes.
Shape the mixture into balls, using a measuring tablespoon to scoop them out of the bowl. Roll the balls in the bacon bits to coat.
Serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to serve. Remove them from the fridge 30 minutes before serving.

name: Mushroom And Zucchini Frittata
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°.
In a medium bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, mustard, salt, and pepper.
Pour egg mixture over in the skillet, top with zucchini, goat cheese, dill, and mushrooms. Transfer the skillet to the oven and bake for 30 minutes.
Remove from the oven and serve.

name: Mexican Chorizo Breakfast Pie
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F. Grease a pie pan.
Combine potato, 1 egg, minced onion, flour, and salt in a bowl.
Pour into the prepared pie pan and smooth down to form a crust.
Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes. Brush the crust with olive oil and continue to bake until golden and set, about 10 minutes more.
Remove from the oven and reduce temperature to 350°F.
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir chorizo in the hot skillet until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes.
Add chopped onion and garlic and saute for another 3 minutes. Remove any extra grease from the pan if desired.
Beat remaining eggs and milk together in a bowl until smooth; add cilantro and cumin.
Spread half of the cheddar cheese onto the potato crust.
Spoon chorizo mixture over and top with remaining cheese. Pour egg mixture over the top.
Bake in the preheated oven until eggs are set and the top of the pie is slightly browned, 35 to 40 minutes. Serve warm.

name: Napolitan Spaghetti
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook the pasta according to the package directions, 8 minutes.
Meanwhile, mince the garlic clove and slice onion, sausages, and bell pepper.
In a large skillet or saute pan, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add the garlic and sauté for 1 minute, just until golden and fragrant.
Add the onions to the pan and saute for 2 minutes.
When the onions are wilted, add the sausages and saute for 1 minute. Add the bell peppers and saute until all is cooked.
Add ketchup and Worcestershire sauce. When the sauce thickens, add the pasta cooking water. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
As soon as the pasta is cooked and drained, add to the pan and toss to combine using tongs.
